name: Wonshe
description:
Wonshe is a simple game inspired by the 1982 game Centipede for the Atari 2600 console.

The origin of the name of the game is a kind of play on words, which is a combination of English and Polish slang.

In the game we shoot at enemies coming out in successive waves, who after being shot down leave walls. When the opponents touch the wall, they go down the board. Unlike other games we don't get points for killing opponents, but for leaving as many walls as possible at the end of each wave.

With each wave more and more enemies come out.

Every 5 waves special enemies come out, which after death do not leave walls and on contact with a wall, destroy it.

The game ends, when the opponents reach the bottom of the board.

Controls:

- Mouse - move

- LMB - shoot

- F1 - full screen (only in desktop version)

- Esc - return to menu

If you are interested, the sounds (including music) are from freesounds.org .

If you find any bugs, let me know about them.

Good luck :)
